intro: Struthiopteris vivipara, commonly known as the common wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each consisting of three heart-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in loose inflorescences. Struthiopteris vivipara is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and recognizable species within its native range.
